name: bauxite mine operation | bauxite | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/729/documentation

Average moisture content of bauxite is approximately 12% (wet mass basis).  The reference flow in this dataset is therefore expressed as 0.88 kg bauxite, without water.; The aluminium content is based on the reported yield of aluminium oxide production (0.39 kg Al2O3/kg wet bauxite).  The aluminium hydroxide is also calculated from the subsequent aluminium oxide production yield and makes the simplifying assumption that all aluminium is bound in alumina trihydrates (Al(OH)3) since the split between alumina trihydrates and monohydrates is unknown.  The maximum error from this assumption is 23%.;The bauxite represents 50% (w/w) of the extracted ore, wet mass basis.

The activity starts with the removal of overburden from a bauxite rich mining site.  Reusable topsoil is normally stored for later mine restoration.

The operations associated with this unit process include:
- the extraction of bauxite rich minerals from the site; 
- beneficiation activities such as washing, screening, or drying; 
- treatment of mining site residues and waste; and 
- site restoration activities such as grading, dressing and replanting.
The output of this unit process is the bauxite to be transported to an alumina refinery.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/07:Mining of metal ores/072:Mining of non-ferrous metal ores/0729:Mining of other non-ferrous metal ores

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data collected from 14 world-wide bauxite mines producing 143.1million metric tons of bauxite, representing about 50% of world-wide aluminium bauxite mining operations.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Average bauxite mining technology world-wide (open mining)
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Mixture of survey and literature.  Survey data collected by IAI from member and non member companies during Feb - July 2016, with analysis and data verification taking place Aug - Dec 2016.  Most values from literature were extracted from previous dataset version (Althaus, 2007, in Classen et al., 2007).  The 50% representativeness cited in "Percent" refers to flows covered by the IAI survey as a percentage of total world production.

exchanges.description: 12% average water content of bauxite, wet mass basis, specified by IAI.

exchanges.description: Gangue material extracted during bauxite extraction.  Represents total ore extracted minus aluminium and gallium content of the ore, considered the two valuable resources contained in the ore.
